name: Github Flavoured Markdown
description: Overview of syntax and common elements for GitHub Flavoured Markdown, a special form of Markdown used across GitHub

Multiple Underscores In Words.val: Markdown transforms underscores (_) into italics, GFM ignores underscores in words

URL Autolinking.val: GFM will autolink standard URLs, so if you want to link to a URL, instead of setting link text

Strikethrough.val: GFM adds syntax to create strikethrough text, which is missing from standard Markdown

Fenced Code Blocks.val: Standard Markdown converts text with four spaces at the beginning of each line into a code block; GFM also supports fenced blocks.

Syntax Highlighting.val: Code blocks can be taken a step further by adding syntax highlighting. In your fenced block, add an optional language identifier

Tables.key:
First Header  | Second Header
------------- | -------------
Content Cell  | Content Cell
Content Cell  | Content Cell
Tables.val:
You can create tables by assembling a list of words and dividing them with hyphens -
(for the first row), and then separating each column with a pipe |

Inline HTML.val: You can use a subset of HTML within your READMEs, issues, and pull requests
